newsitem.title: USA: John du Pont name stripped from arena.
newsitem.headline: John du Pont name stripped from arena.

text.p: Villanova University has stripped John du Pont's name from a campus sports arena named after the chemical fortune heir who was convicted of murder earlier this year.

The suburban Philadelphia university took the step quietly over the Independence Day weekend. "The university has decided that the du Pont name is no longer appropriate on the pavillion, so we just decided to take it down," spokeswoman Barbara Clement said Tuesday.

Du Pont, an avid sports fan, had been a benefactor of the 6,500 seat building previously known as the John E. du Pont Pavillion. In February, du Pont was found guilty but mentally ill on a third degree-murder charge in connection with the January 1996 killing of Olympic champion wrestler David Schultz.
Du Pont was sentenced in May to 13 to 30 years' confinement.
Clement said the arena will be known as "The Pavillion."
